013package org.apache.juneau.bean.swagger;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.Utils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ClassUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;
018import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.map;
019import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ConverterUtils.*;
020
021import java.util.*;
022
023import org.apache.juneau.*;
024import org.apache.juneau.collections.*;
025import org.apache.juneau.common.utils.*;
026import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
027import org.apache.juneau.json.*;
028import org.apache.juneau.objecttools.*;
029
030/**
031 * This is the root document object for the Swagger 2.0 API specification.
032 *
033 * <p>
034 * The Swagger Object is the root document that describes an entire API. It contains metadata about the API,
035 * available paths and operations, parameters, responses, security definitions, and other information. This is
036 * the Swagger 2.0 specification (predecessor to OpenAPI 3.0).
037 *
038 * <h5 class='section'>Swagger Specification:</h5>
039 * <p>
040 * The Swagger Object is composed of the following fields:
041 * <ul class='spaced-list'>
042 *    <li><c>swagger</c> (string, REQUIRED) - The Swagger Specification version (must be <js>"2.0"</js>)
043 *    <li><c>info</c> ({@link Info}, REQUIRED) - Provides metadata about the API
044 *    <li><c>host</c> (string) - The host (name or IP) serving the API
045 *    <li><c>basePath</c> (string) - The base path on which the API is served (relative to host)
046 *    <li><c>schemes</c> (array of string) - The transfer protocols of the API (e.g., <js>"http"</js>, <js>"https"</js>)
047 *    <li><c>consumes</c> (array of string) - A list of MIME types the APIs can consume
048 *    <li><c>produces</c> (array of string) - A list of MIME types the APIs can produce
049 *    <li><c>paths</c> (map of {@link OperationMap}, REQUIRED) - The available paths and operations for the API
050 *    <li><c>definitions</c> (map of {@link SchemaInfo}) - Schema definitions that can be referenced
051 *    <li><c>parameters</c> (map of {@link ParameterInfo}) - Parameters definitions that can be referenced
052 *    <li><c>responses</c> (map of {@link ResponseInfo}) - Response definitions that can be referenced
053 *    <li><c>securityDefinitions</c> (map of {@link SecurityScheme}) - Security scheme definitions
054 *    <li><c>security</c> (array of map) - Security requirements applied to all operations
055 *    <li><c>tags</c> (array of {@link Tag}) - A list of tags used by the specification with additional metadata
056 *    <li><c>externalDocs</c> ({@link ExternalDocumentation}) - Additional external documentation
057 * </ul>
058 *
059 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
060 * <p class='bjava'>
061 *    <jc>// Create a Swagger document</jc>
062 *    Swagger <jv>doc</jv> = <jk>new</jk> Swagger()
063 *       .setSwagger(<js>"2.0"</js>)
064 *       .setInfo(
065 *          <jk>new</jk> Info()
066 *             .setTitle(<js>"Pet Store API"</js>)
067 *             .setVersion(<js>"1.0.0"</js>)
068 *       )
069 *       .setHost(<js>"petstore.swagger.io"</js>)
070 *       .setBasePath(<js>"/v2"</js>)
071 *       .setSchemes(<js>"https"</js>)
072 *       .addPath(<js>"/pets"</js>, <js>"get"</js>,
073 *          <jk>new</jk> Operation()
074 *             .setSummary(<js>"List all pets"</js>)
075 *             .addResponse(<js>"200"</js>, <jk>new</jk> ResponseInfo(<js>"Success"</js>))
076 *       );
077 * </p>
078 *
079 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
080 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/specification/v2/">Swagger 2.0 Specification</a>
081 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/docs/specification/2-0/basic-structure/">Swagger Basic Structure</a>
082 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/JuneauBeanSwagger2">juneau-bean-swagger-v2</a>
083 * </ul>
084 */
085@FluentSetters
086public class Swagger extends SwaggerElement {
087
088   /** Represents a null swagger */
089   public static final Swagger NULL = new Swagger();
090
091   private static final Comparator<String> PATH_COMPARATOR = (o1, o2) -> o1.replace('{', '@').compareTo(o2.replace('{', '@'));
092
093   private String
094      swagger = "2.0",  // NOSONAR - Intentional naming.
095      host,
096      basePath;
097   private Info info;
098   private ExternalDocumentation externalDocs;
099   private Set<String> schemes;
100   private Set<MediaType>
101      consumes,
102      produces;
103   private Set<Tag> tags;
104   private List<Map<String,List<String>>> security;
105   private Map<String,JsonMap> definitions;
106   private Map<String,ParameterInfo> parameters;
107   private Map<String,ResponseInfo> responses;
108   private Map<String,SecurityScheme> securityDefinitions;
109   private Map<String,OperationMap> paths;
110
111   /**
112    * Default constructor.
113    */
114   public Swagger() {}
115
116   /**
117    * Copy constructor.
118    *
119    * @param copyFrom The object to copy.
120    */
121   public Swagger(Swagger copyFrom) {
122      super(copyFrom);
123
124      this.basePath = copyFrom.basePath;
125      this.consumes = copyOf(copyFrom.consumes);
126      this.externalDocs = copyFrom.externalDocs == null ? null : copyFrom.externalDocs.copy();
127      this.host = copyFrom.host;
128      this.info = copyFrom.info == null ? null : copyFrom.info.copy();
129      this.produces = copyOf(copyFrom.produces);
130      this.schemes = copyOf(copyFrom.schemes);
131      this.swagger = copyFrom.swagger;
132
133      // TODO - Definitions are not deep copied, so they should not contain references.
134      this.definitions = copyOf(copyFrom.definitions, JsonMap::new);
135
136      this.paths = copyOf(copyFrom.paths, v -> {
137         var m = new OperationMap();
138         v.forEach((k2,v2) -> m.put(k2, v2.copy()));
139         return m;
140      });
141
142      this.parameters = copyOf(copyFrom.parameters, ParameterInfo::copy);
143      this.responses = copyOf(copyFrom.responses, ResponseInfo::copy);
144      this.securityDefinitions = copyOf(copyFrom.securityDefinitions, SecurityScheme::copy);
145
146      this.security = copyOf(copyFrom.security, x -> {
147         Map<String,List<String>> m2 = map();
148         x.forEach((k,v) -> m2.put(k, copyOf(v)));
149         return m2;
150      });
151
152      this.tags = copyOf(copyFrom.tags, x -> x.copy());
153   }
154
155   /**
156    * Make a deep copy of this object.
157    *
158    * @return A deep copy of this object.
159    */
160   public Swagger copy() {
161      return new Swagger(this);
162   }
163
164   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
165   // Properties
166   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
167
168   /**
169    * Bean property getter:  <property>basePath</property>.
170    *
171    * <p>
172    * The base path on which the API is served, which is relative to the <c>host</c>.
173    *
174    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
175    */
176   public String getBasePath() {
177      return basePath;
178   }
179
180   /**
181    * Bean property setter:  <property>basePath</property>.
182    *
183    * <p>
184    * The base path on which the API is served, which is relative to the <c>host</c>.
185    *
186    * @param value
187    *    The new value for this property.
188    *    <br>If it is not included, the API is served directly under the <c>host</c>.
189    *    <br>The value MUST start with a leading slash (/).
190    *    <br>The <c>basePath</c> does not support <a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/specification/v2#pathTemplating">path templating</a>.
191    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
192    * @return This object.
193    */
194   public Swagger setBasePath(String value) {
195      basePath = value;
196      return this;
197   }
198
199   /**
200    * Bean property getter:  <property>consumes</property>.
201    *
202    * <p>
203    * A list of MIME types the APIs can consume.
204    *
205    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
206    */
207   public Set<MediaType> getConsumes() {
208      return consumes;
209   }
210
211   /**
212    * Bean property setter:  <property>consumes</property>.
213    *
214    * <p>
215    * A list of MIME types the APIs can consume.
216    *
217    * @param value
218    *    The new value for this property.
219    *    <br>Value MUST be as described under <a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/specification#mimeTypes">Swagger Mime Types</a>.
220    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
221    * @return This object.
222    */
223   public Swagger setConsumes(Collection<MediaType> value) {
224      consumes = setFrom(value);
225      return this;
226   }
227
228   /**
229    * Bean property appender:  <property>consumes</property>.
230    *
231    * <p>
232    * A list of MIME types the APIs can consume.
233    *
234    * @param values
235    *    The values to add to this property.
236    *    <br>Values MUST be as described under <a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/specification#mimeTypes">Swagger Mime Types</a>.
237    *    <br>Ignored if <jk>null</jk>.
238    * @return This object.
239    */
240   public Swagger addConsumes(MediaType...values) {
241      consumes = setBuilder(consumes).sparse().add(values).build();
242      return this;
243   }
244
245   /**
246    * Bean property appender:  <property>consumes</property>.
247    *
248    * <p>
249    * A list of MIME types the APIs can consume.
250    *
251    * @param values
252    *    The values to add to this property.
253    *    <br>Ignored if <jk>null</jk>.
254    * @return This object.
255    */
256   public Swagger addConsumes(Collection<MediaType> values) {
257      consumes = setBuilder(consumes).sparse().addAll(values).build();
258      return this;
259   }
260
261   /**
262    * Bean property fluent setter:  <property>consumes</property>.
263    *
264    * <p>
265    * A list of MIME types the APIs can consume.
266    *
267    * @param value
268    *    The values to set on this property.
269    * @return This object.
270    */
271   public Swagger setConsumes(MediaType...value) {
272      setConsumes(setBuilder(MediaType.class).sparse().add(value).build());
273      return this;
274   }
275
276   /**
277    * Bean property getter:  <property>definitions</property>.
278    *
279    * <p>
280    * An object to hold data types produced and consumed by operations.
281    *
282    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
283    */
284   public Map<String,JsonMap> getDefinitions() {
285      return definitions;
286   }
287
288   /**
289    * Bean property setter:  <property>definitions</property>.
290    *
291    * <p>
292    * An object to hold data types produced and consumed by operations.
293    *
294    * @param value
295    *    The new value for this property.
296    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
297    * @return This object.
298    */
299   public Swagger setDefinitions(Map<String,JsonMap> value) {
300      definitions = copyOf(value);
301      return this;
302   }
303
304   /**
305    * Bean property appender:  <property>definitions</property>.
306    *
307    * <p>
308    * Adds a single value to the <property>definitions</property> property.
309    *
310    * @param name A definition name.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
311    * @param schema The schema that the name defines.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
312    * @return This object.
313    */
314   public Swagger addDefinition(String name, JsonMap schema) {
315      assertArgNotNull("name", name);
316      assertArgNotNull("schema", schema);
317      definitions = mapBuilder(definitions).sparse().add(name, schema).build();
318      return this;
319   }
320
321   /**
322    * Bean property getter:  <property>externalDocs</property>.
323    *
324    * <p>
325    * Additional external documentation.
326    *
327    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
328    */
329   public ExternalDocumentation getExternalDocs() {
330      return externalDocs;
331   }
332
333   /**
334    * Bean property setter:  <property>externalDocs</property>.
335    *
336    * <p>
337    * Additional external documentation.
338    *
339    * @param value
340    *    The new value for this property.
341    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
342    * @return This object.
343    */
344   public Swagger setExternalDocs(ExternalDocumentation value) {
345      externalDocs = value;
346      return this;
347   }
348
349   /**
350    * Bean property getter:  <property>host</property>.
351    *
352    * <p>
353    * The host (name or IP) serving the API.
354    *
355    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
356    */
357   public String getHost() {
358      return host;
359   }
360
361   /**
362    * Bean property setter:  <property>host</property>.
363    *
364    * <p>
365    * The host (name or IP) serving the API.
366    *
367    * @param value
368    *    The new value for this property.
369    *    <br>This MUST be the host only and does not include the scheme nor sub-paths.
370    *    <br>It MAY include a port.
371    *    <br>If the host is not included, the host serving the documentation is to be used (including the port).
372    *    <br>The host does not support <a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/specification/v2#pathTemplating">path templating</a>
373    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
374    * @return This object.
375    */
376   public Swagger setHost(String value) {
377      host = value;
378      return this;
379   }
380
381   /**
382    * Bean property getter:  <property>info</property>.
383    *
384    * <p>
385    * Provides metadata about the API.
386    *
387    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
388    */
389   public Info getInfo() {
390      return info;
391   }
392
393   /**
394    * Bean property setter:  <property>info</property>.
395    *
396    * <p>
397    * Provides metadata about the API.
398    *
399    * @param value
400    *    The new value for this property.
401    *    <br>Property value is required.
402    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
403    * @return This object.
404    */
405   public Swagger setInfo(Info value) {
406      info = value;
407      return this;
408   }
409
410   /**
411    * Bean property getter:  <property>parameters</property>.
412    *
413    * <p>
414    * An object to hold parameters that can be used across operations.
415    *
416    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
417    */
418   public Map<String,ParameterInfo> getParameters() {
419      return parameters;
420   }
421
422   /**
423    * Bean property setter:  <property>parameters</property>.
424    *
425    * <p>
426    * An object to hold parameters that can be used across operations.
427    *
428    * @param value
429    *    The new value for this property.
430    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
431    * @return This object.
432    */
433   public Swagger setParameters(Map<String,ParameterInfo> value) {
434      parameters = copyOf(value);
435      return this;
436   }
437
438   /**
439    * Bean property appender:  <property>parameters</property>.
440    *
441    * <p>
442    * Adds a single value to the <property>parameter</property> property.
443    *
444    * @param name The parameter name.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
445    * @param parameter The parameter definition.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
446    * @return This object.
447    */
448   public Swagger addParameter(String name, ParameterInfo parameter) {
449      assertArgNotNull("name", name);
450      assertArgNotNull("parameter", parameter);
451      parameters = mapBuilder(parameters).sparse().add(name, parameter).build();
452      return this;
453   }
454
455   /**
456    * Bean property getter:  <property>paths</property>.
457    *
458    * <p>
459    * The available paths and operations for the API.
460    *
461    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
462    */
463   public Map<String,OperationMap> getPaths() {
464      return paths;
465   }
466
467   /**
468    * Bean property setter:  <property>paths</property>.
469    *
470    * <p>
471    * The available paths and operations for the API.
472    *
473    * @param value
474    *    The new value for this property.
475    *    <br>Property value is required.
476    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
477    * @return This object.
478    */
479   public Swagger setPaths(Map<String,OperationMap> value) {
480      paths = mapBuilder(String.class,OperationMap.class).sparse().sorted(PATH_COMPARATOR).addAll(value).build();
481      return this;
482   }
483
484   /**
485    * Bean property appender:  <property>paths</property>.
486    *
487    * <p>
488    * Adds a single value to the <property>paths</property> property.
489    *
490    * @param path The path template.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
491    * @param methodName The HTTP method name.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
492    * @param operation The operation that describes the path.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
493    * @return This object.
494    */
495   public Swagger addPath(String path, String methodName, Operation operation) {
496      assertArgNotNull("path", path);
497      assertArgNotNull("methodName", methodName);
498      assertArgNotNull("operation", operation);
499      if (paths == null)
500         paths = new TreeMap<>(PATH_COMPARATOR);
501      getPaths().computeIfAbsent(path, k -> new OperationMap()).put(methodName, operation);
502      return this;
503   }
504
505   /**
506    * Bean property getter:  <property>produces</property>.
507    *
508    * <p>
509    * A list of MIME types the APIs can produce.
510    *
511    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
512    */
513   public Set<MediaType> getProduces() {
514      return produces;
515   }
516
517   /**
518    * Bean property setter:  <property>produces</property>.
519    *
520    * <p>
521    * A list of MIME types the APIs can produce.
522    *
523    * @param value
524    *    The new value for this property.
525    *    <br>Value MUST be as described under <a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/specification#mimeTypes">Swagger Mime Types</a>.
526    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
527    * @return This object.
528    */
529   public Swagger setProduces(Collection<MediaType> value) {
530      produces = setFrom(value);
531      return this;
532   }
533
534   /**
535    * Adds one or more values to the <property>produces</property> property.
536    *
537    * <p>
538    * A list of MIME types the APIs can produce.
539    *
540    * @param values
541    *    The values to add to this property.
542    *    <br>Value MUST be as described under <a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/specification#mimeTypes">Swagger Mime Types</a>.
543    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
544    * @return This object.
545    */
546   public Swagger addProduces(MediaType...values) {
547      produces = setBuilder(produces).sparse().add(values).build();
548      return this;
549   }
550
551   /**
552    * Bean property appender:  <property>produces</property>.
553    *
554    * <p>
555    * A list of MIME types the APIs can produce.
556    *
557    * @param values
558    *    The values to add to this property.
559    *    <br>Value MUST be as described under <a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/specification#mimeTypes">Swagger Mime Types</a>.
560    *    <br>Ignored if <jk>null</jk>.
561    * @return This object.
562    */
563   public Swagger addProduces(Collection<MediaType> values) {
564      produces = setBuilder(produces).sparse().addAll(values).build();
565      return this;
566   }
567
568   /**
569    * Bean property fluent setter:  <property>produces</property>.
570    *

573    *

580      return this;

591   public Map<String,ResponseInfo> getResponses() {
592      return responses;
593   }
594
595   /**
596    * Bean property setter:  <property>responses</property>.
597    *
598    * <p>
599    * An object to hold responses that can be used across operations.

603    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
604    * @return This object.
605    */
606   public Swagger setResponses(Map<String,ResponseInfo> value) {
607      responses = copyOf(value);
608      return this;
609   }
610
611   /**
612    * Bean property appender:  <property>responses</property>.
613    *
614    * <p>
615    * Adds a single value to the <property>responses</property> property.
616    *
617    * @param name The response name.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
618    * @param response The response definition.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
619    * @return This object.
620    */
621   public Swagger addResponse(String name, ResponseInfo response) {
622      assertArgNotNull("name", name);
623      assertArgNotNull("response", response);
624      responses = mapBuilder(responses).sparse().add(name, response).build();
625      return this;
626   }
627
628   /**
629    * Bean property getter:  <property>schemes</property>.
630    *
631    * <p>
632    * The transfer protocol of the API.
633    *
634    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
635    */
636   public Set<String> getSchemes() {
637      return schemes;
638   }
639
640   /**
641    * Bean property setter:  <property>schemes</property>.
642    *
643    * <p>
644    * The transfer protocol of the API.
645    *
646    * @param value
647    *    The new value for this property.
648    *    <br>Valid values:
649    *    <ul>
650    *       <li><js>"http"</js>
651    *       <li><js>"https"</js>
652    *       <li><js>"ws"</js>
653    *       <li><js>"wss"</js>
654    *    </ul>
655    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
656    * @return This object.
657    */
658   public Swagger setSchemes(Collection<String> value) {
659      schemes = setFrom(value);
660      return this;
661   }
662
663   /**
664    * Bean property appender:  <property>schemes</property>.
665    *
666    * <p>
667    * The transfer protocol of the API.
668    *
669    * @param values
670    *    The values to add to this property.
671    *    <br>Valid values:
672    *    <ul>
673    *       <li><js>"http"</js>
674    *       <li><js>"https"</js>
675    *       <li><js>"ws"</js>
676    *       <li><js>"wss"</js>
677    *    </ul>
678    *    <br>Ignored if <jk>null</jk>.
679    * @return This object.
680    */
681   public Swagger addSchemes(String...values) {
682      schemes = setBuilder(schemes).sparse().add(values).build();
683      return this;
684   }
685
686   /**
687    * Bean property appender:  <property>schemes</property>.
688    *
689    * <p>

691    *
692    * @param values
693    *    The values to add to this property.
694    *    <br>Valid values:
695    *    <ul>
696    *       <li><js>"http"</js>

698    *       <li><js>"ws"</js>
699    *       <li><js>"wss"</js>
700    *    </ul>
701    *    <br>Ignored if <jk>null</jk>.
702    * @return This object.

704   public Swagger addSchemes(Collection<String> values) {
705      schemes = setBuilder(schemes).sparse().addAll(values).build();
706      return this;
707   }

722      return this;

733   public List<Map<String,List<String>>> getSecurity() {
734      return security;
735   }

740    * <p>
741    * A declaration of which security schemes are applied for the API as a whole.
742    *
743    * @param value
744    *    The new value for this property.

750      return this;

753   /**
754    * Bean property appender:  <property>security</property>.
755    *
756    * <p>
757    * Adds a single value to the <property>securityDefinitions</property> property.
758    *
759    * @param scheme The security scheme that applies to this operation  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
760    * @param alternatives
761    *    The list of values describes alternative security schemes that can be used (that is, there is a logical OR between the security requirements).
762    * @return This object.
763    */
764   public Swagger addSecurity(String scheme, String...alternatives) {
765      assertArgNotNull("scheme", scheme);
766      Map<String,List<String>> m = map();
767      m.put(scheme, alist(alternatives));
768      security = listBuilder(security).sparse().addAll(Collections.singleton(m)).build();
769      return this;
770   }
771

781    * @return This object.

785      return this;

875    * Bean property setter:  <property>tags</property>.

877    * <p>
878    * A list of tags used by the specification with additional metadata.
879    *
880    * @param value
881    *    The new value for this property.
882    *    <br>The order of the tags can be used to reflect on their order by the parsing tools.
883    *    <br>Not all tags that are used by the <a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/specification/v2#operationObject">Operation Object</a> must be declared.
884    *    <br>The tags that are not declared may be organized randomly or based on the tools' logic.
885    *    <br>Each tag name in the list MUST be unique.
886    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
887    * @return This object.
888    */

890      tags = setFrom(value);
891      return this;

953
954   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
955   // Convenience methods
956   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
957
958   /**
959    * Shortcut for calling <c>getPaths().get(path);</c>
960    *
961    * @param path The path (e.g. <js>"/foo"</js>).  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
962    * @return The operation map for the specified path, or <jk>null</jk> if it doesn't exist.
963    */
964   public OperationMap getPath(String path) {
965      assertArgNotNull("path", path);
966      return opt(getPaths()).map(x -> x.get(path)).orElse(null);
967   }
968
969   /**
970    * Shortcut for calling <c>getPaths().get(path).get(operation);</c>
971    *
972    * @param path The path (e.g. <js>"/foo"</js>).  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
973    * @param operation The HTTP operation (e.g. <js>"get"</js>).  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
974    * @return The operation for the specified path and operation id, or <jk>null</jk> if it doesn't exist.
975    */
976   public Operation getOperation(String path, String operation) {
977      assertArgNotNull("path", path);
978      assertArgNotNull("operation", operation);
979      return opt(getPath(path)).map(x -> x.get(operation)).orElse(null);
980   }
981
982   /**
983    * Shortcut for calling <c>getPaths().get(path).get(operation).getResponse(status);</c>
984    *
985    * @param path The path (e.g. <js>"/foo"</js>).  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
986    * @param operation The HTTP operation (e.g. <js>"get"</js>).  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
987    * @param status The HTTP response status (e.g. <js>"200"</js>).  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
988    * @return The operation for the specified path and operation id, or <jk>null</jk> if it doesn't exist.
989    */
990   public ResponseInfo getResponseInfo(String path, String operation, String status) {
991      assertArgNotNull("path", path);
992      assertArgNotNull("operation", operation);
993      assertArgNotNull("status", status);
994      return opt(getPath(path)).map(x -> x.get(operation)).map(x -> x.getResponse(status)).orElse(null);
995   }
996
997   /**
998    * Shortcut for calling <c>getPaths().get(path).get(operation).getResponse(status);</c>
999    *
1000    * @param path The path (e.g. <js>"/foo"</js>).
1001    * @param operation The HTTP operation (e.g. <js>"get"</js>).
1002    * @param status The HTTP response status (e.g. <js>"200"</js>).
1003    * @return The operation for the specified path and operation id, or <jk>null</jk> if it doesn't exist.
1004    */
1005   public ResponseInfo getResponseInfo(String path, String operation, int status) {
1006      return getResponseInfo(path, operation, String.valueOf(status));
1007   }
1008
1009   /**
1010    * Convenience method for calling <c>getPath(path).get(method).getParameter(in,name);</c>
1011    *
1012    * @param path The HTTP path.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
1013    * @param method The HTTP method.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
1014    * @param in The parameter type.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
1015    * @param name The parameter name.  Can be <jk>null</jk> for parameter type <c>body</c>.
1016    * @return The parameter information or <jk>null</jk> if not found.
1017    */
1018   public ParameterInfo getParameterInfo(String path, String method, String in, String name) {
1019      assertArgNotNull("path", path);
1020      assertArgNotNull("method", method);
1021      assertArgNotNull("in", in);
1022      return opt(getPath(path)).map(x -> x.get(method)).map(x -> x.getParameter(in, name)).orElse(null);
1023   }
1024
1025   // <FluentSetters>
1026
1027   // </FluentSetters>
1028
1029   @Override /* SwaggerElement */
1030   public <T> T get(String property, Class<T> type) {
1031      assertArgNotNull("property", property);
1032      return switch (property) {
1033         case "basePath" -> toType(getBasePath(), type);
1034         case "consumes" -> toType(getConsumes(), type);
1035         case "definitions" -> toType(getDefinitions(), type);
1036         case "externalDocs" -> toType(getExternalDocs(), type);
1037         case "host" -> toType(getHost(), type);
1038         case "info" -> toType(getInfo(), type);
1039         case "parameters" -> toType(getParameters(), type);
1040         case "paths" -> toType(getPaths(), type);
1041         case "produces" -> toType(getProduces(), type);
1042         case "responses" -> toType(getResponses(), type);
1043         case "schemes" -> toType(getSchemes(), type);
1044         case "security" -> toType(getSecurity(), type);
1045         case "securityDefinitions" -> toType(getSecurityDefinitions(), type);
1046         case "swagger" -> toType(getSwagger(), type);
1047         case "tags" -> toType(getTags(), type);
1048         default -> super.get(property, type);
1049      };
1050   }
1051
1052   @SuppressWarnings("rawtypes")
1053   @Override /* SwaggerElement */
1054   public Swagger set(String property, Object value) {
1055      assertArgNotNull("property", property);
1056      return switch (property) {
1057         case "basePath" -> setBasePath(Utils.s(value));
1058         case "consumes" -> setConsumes(listBuilder(MediaType.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
1059         case "definitions" -> setDefinitions(mapBuilder(String.class,JsonMap.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
1060         case "externalDocs" -> setExternalDocs(toType(value, ExternalDocumentation.class));
1061         case "host" -> setHost(Utils.s(value));
1062         case "info" -> setInfo(toType(value, Info.class));
1063         case "parameters" -> setParameters(mapBuilder(String.class,ParameterInfo.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
1064         case "paths" -> setPaths(mapBuilder(String.class,OperationMap.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
1065         case "produces" -> setProduces(listBuilder(MediaType.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
1066         case "responses" -> setResponses(mapBuilder(String.class,ResponseInfo.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
1067         case "schemes" -> setSchemes(listBuilder(String.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
1068         case "security" -> setSecurity((List)listBuilder(Map.class,String.class,List.class,String.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
1069         case "securityDefinitions" -> setSecurityDefinitions(mapBuilder(String.class,SecurityScheme.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
1070         case "swagger" -> setSwagger(Utils.s(value));
1071         case "tags" -> setTags(listBuilder(Tag.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
1072         default -> {
1073            super.set(property, value);
1074            yield this;
1075         }
1076      };
1077   }
1078
1079   @Override /* SwaggerElement */
1080   public Set<String> keySet() {
1081      var s = setBuilder(String.class)
1082         .addIf(basePath != null, "basePath")
1083         .addIf(consumes != null, "consumes")
1084         .addIf(definitions != null, "definitions")
1085         .addIf(externalDocs != null, "externalDocs")
1086         .addIf(host != null, "host")
1087         .addIf(info != null, "info")
1088         .addIf(parameters != null, "parameters")
1089         .addIf(paths != null, "paths")
1090         .addIf(produces != null, "produces")
1091         .addIf(responses != null, "responses")
1092         .addIf(schemes != null, "schemes")
1093         .addIf(security != null, "security")
1094         .addIf(securityDefinitions != null, "securityDefinitions")
1095         .addIf(swagger != null, "swagger")
1096         .addIf(tags != null, "tags")
1097         .build();
1098      return new MultiSet<>(s, super.keySet());
1099   }

1101   /**
1102    * A synonym of {@link #toString()}.
1103    * @return This object serialized as JSON.
1104    */
1105   public String asJson() {
1106      return toString();
1107   }
1108
1109   @Override /* Object */
1110   public String toString() {
1111      return JsonSerializer.DEFAULT.toString(this);
1112   }
1113
1114   /**
1115    * Resolves a <js>"$ref"</js> tags to nodes in this swagger document.
1116    *
1117    * @param <T> The class to convert the reference to.
1118    * @param ref The ref tag value.  Must not be <jk>null</jk> or blank.
1119    * @param c The class to convert the reference to.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
1120    * @return The referenced node, or <jk>null</jk> if not found.
1121    */
1122   public <T> T findRef(String ref, Class<T> c) {
1123      assertArgNotNullOrBlank("ref", ref);
1124      assertArgNotNull("c", c);
1125      if (! ref.startsWith("#/"))
1126         throw new BasicRuntimeException("Unsupported reference:  ''{0}''", ref);
1127      try {
1128         return new ObjectRest(this).get(ref.substring(1), c);
1129      } catch (Exception e) {
1130         throw new BeanRuntimeException(e, c, "Reference ''{0}'' could not be converted to type ''{1}''.", ref, className(c));
1131      }
1132   }
1133
1134   /**
1135    * Sets strict mode on this bean.
1136    *
1137    * @return This object.
1138    */
1139   @Override
1140   public Swagger strict() {
1141      super.strict();
1142      return this;
1143   }
1144
1145   /**
1146    * Sets strict mode on this bean.
1147    *
1148    * @param value
1149    *    The new value for this property.
1150    *    <br>Non-boolean values will be converted to boolean using <code>Boolean.<jsm>valueOf</jsm>(value.toString())</code>.
1151    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> (interpreted as <jk>false</jk>).
1152    * @return This object.
1153    */
1154   @Override
1155   public Swagger strict(Object value) {
1156      super.strict(value);
1157      return this;
1158   }
